title: Ethical Practices in Online Education: Micro-Learning Based on Applied Philosophy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational ethics concepts and experience with online learning
context.additional_context: A course focused on analyzing ethical dilemmas and cultivating practical judgment skills in a smartphone-based learning environment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more ethical conflict scenarios that may occur in online learning environments.
Learners can apply Aristotle’s concept of ‘phronesis’ (practical wisdom) to make ethical decisions in everyday educational contexts.
Learners can present five ethical standards for establishing learner-instructor relationships in digital learning environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
